item.description:
Mount Tom Walk, Litchfield CT

When: Postponed due to weather to Sunday May 31, 1:30 PM

This will be a walk up Mount Tom to an old fire lookout tower. It has a panoramic view in all directions across Litchfield County from its 1325 foot elevation. On a clear day you can see 30 miles. This park was a gift to the state from Charles Senff in 1913. The Civilian Conservation Corps did a great deal of improvements in the 1930’s.

This will be an easy walk of about 2 miles with an up hill climb. Social walking pace. We will be out for 2 to 3 hours. Rain cancels. Dogs and children are welcome as long as they are calm and well behaved.

A state parking fee is collected at the entrance booth.

Location: 96 Mount Tom Rd, New Preston, CT. After entering, follow the park road to the end and loop around. We will meet in the parking lot after the beach.
http://www.mapquest.c...

Walk is being lead by Larry. Contact him through his profile: http://www.meetup.com...
